text: the heart can stop for several reasons
classically we think of a TV show where
you watch the monitor and it flatlines
the heart no longer is beating but many
times in a cardiac arrest it's not that
the heart has completely stopped it's
that an irregular heart rhythm has
developed and that irregular heart
rhythm is not able to have the force of
the heart to beat and that can either be
from a very fast rhythm from the bottom
of their heart or it can be that there's
been a slowdown to stopping of their
heart the reason that's important to
know is the fact that blood is not
getting to the body because the heart is
not able to pump it one of the most
pressing areas where we want to make
sure to maintain blood is to the brain
because as blood supply and therefore
oxygen decreases its route to the brain
we're seeing that even within minutes
can cause damage and that's why there's
a benefit to defibrillation and so we
also see in TV shows and movies that
they put two of paddles on somebody's
chest and by giving the electrical shock
you're able to reset the heart back to a
normal heart rhythm
